content.description: This route starts low and right with a campus move, then traverses left beneath a bulge until you are under two distinct huecos. Make a long reach for a dish with the right hand, then lunge for the hueco to finish.
content.protection: Crash-pads and spotter recommended for the finish due to uneven and pointy landing. (Relatively safe for Hueco standards)
content.location:
This problem is located in the Morgue area.  

  From Matt Wilder's Guidebook, "this problem faces the Warm Up Boulder and is about 300ft. uphill from it".  

  It is most easily reached by scrambling up the low-angle slabs that contour into the landing area for the Warm Up boulder. This is the only prominent line on the rock. Descent is very straightforward.

content.description: Start T-Bone Shuffle and when you get to the horn head straight up the arete with long moves. The holds start a little thin, but get better the higher you go. Beware of choss.

This is the best roof crack at Hueco Tanks.  There are several starts - my preferred start is a low sit start. Two finishes to this route: exit when the crack ends at V4 or squeeze through the gap at V5. 

  Good tape job mandatory.  Send this one and you're ready for Separate Reality.
content.location: Up slabs behind the Warm Up Boulder and around T-Bone Shuffle.

content.description:
There's an error in Matt Wilders guide stating that this is Playtex Husband. However. Playtex Husband was established many years before this and can be found further down on the blunt arete. The correct listing is in J. Sherman's 2nd Edition Guide on pages 36-37. I established this BP with friends during 1997. Anyway, 

  Start way back in the cave on the deep jug flake. Under-cling the flake and follow it out to the lip. The flake turns into a vertical crack. Climb the crack to the top.  

  V2 Variation:   Escape the vertical crack finish by traversing left on the lip to the hueco line. Follow the huecos to the top on easy rock.
content.protection: Semi-Highball, bring plenty of crash pads for the lip move and last section.
content.location: Follow the ramp of rock that forms Mammary Lane, uphill to a gully and cave; just before the Morgue.

content.description: The best roof crack at Hueco.
